com.github.bjarneh.utilz
Class path

java.lang.Object
  com.github.bjarneh.utilz.path

public class path
extends Object

Some common path utility functions. 


  // Typical use:

  String validPath;

  validPath = path.fromSlash("/some/file/name");
  validPath = path.join(new String[]{"some","dir","name"});

  String[] files  = path.walk(validPath);
note: There is a lot of comments here since this is meant to be a library with some documentation, i.e. make sure you turn on your comment folding before you start reading this file.

public static String[] walk(String root,
                            FileFilter filter)
Fetch the root relative path names of all/some files under root.

Parameters:
root - of the file tree you would like to fetch
filter - out parts of your file tree using a FileFilter
Returns:
a list of path names under root

This function cleans up a path name, by removing duplicates and ending File.separator.

Parameters:
p - a path name
Returns:
a path with no ending or duplicate File.separator
